description: Borrowed from Latin māchinārī (“scheme, plot”), a verb based on Latin māchina (“machine, contrivance, device, scheme”), an early borrowing from Ancient Greek. See also machine.

verbs.description: machinate (third-person singular simple present machinates, present participle machinating, simple past and past participle machinated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To devise a plot or secret plan; to conspire.
examples: Had she already managed to machinate a cushy job for her husband?
